required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interleukin-1 Receptor Antagonist Gene Polymorphism and Adverse Pregnancy Outcome in Turkish Women
clinical_study.official_title: Interleukin-1 Receptor Antagonist Gene Polymorphism and Adverse Pregnancy Outcome in Turkish Women

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators hypothesized that the IL-1A (+4895), IL-1B (+3954), and IL-1RN gene polymorphisms may be associated with PLBW. Smoking has been well documented by numerous studies as a major environmental risk factor for periodontitis and adverse pregnancy outcomes. Therefore, the investigators only selected non-smoking individuals in this study as the smoking-related risk could obscure the polymorphism-related increase in risk for periodontitis and adverse pregnancy outcomes. This study aimed to determine the association between IL-1A (+4895), IL-1B (+3954), and IL-1RN polymorphisms with adverse pregnancy outcomes and periodontitis in a non-smoking Turkish population.

detailed_description.textblock: Pregnant women between 18-35 years of age with single gestation and with ≥20 on-crowded teeth excluding third molars were included in this study. Subjects were divided into normal birth (NB) and PLBW groups on the basis of their pregnancy outcome. Women who delivered an infant with a birth weight of more than 2500 g after 37 weeks of gestation were placed in the NB group. Women who delivered infants whose birth weight was below 2500 g or before 37 weeks of gestation were placed in the PLBW group. Current/past tobacco user, alcohol abuse, history of high-risk gestation, hypertension, gestational diabetes, any systemic disease and placenta previa were the exclusion criteria for this study. Maternal, obstetric, and demographic factors such as maternal age, maternal education, regular prenatal care, genitourinary tract infections during pregnancy, total number of births, previous PLBW, and antibiotic use during the pregnancy period were also recorded.

primary_outcome.measure: Interleukin-1 receptor antagonist gene polymorphism and adverse pregnancy outcome in Turkish women

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women between 18-35 years of age with single gestation and with ≥20 on-crowded teeth excluding third molars were included in this study. Subjects were divided into normal birth (NB) and PLBW groups on the basis of their pregnancy outcome. Women who delivered an infant with a birth weight of more than 2500 g after 37 weeks of gestation were placed in the NB group. Women who delivered infants whose birth weight was below 2500 g or before 37 weeks of gestation were placed in the PLBW group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects were divided into normal birth (NB) and PLBW groups on the basis of their pregnancy outcome. Women who delivered an infant with a birth weight of more than 2500 g after 37 weeks of gestation were placed in the NB group.
Exclusion Criteria:
Current/past tobacco user, alcohol abuse, history of high-risk gestation, hypertension, gestational diabetes, any systemic disease and placenta previa were the exclusion criteria for this study.

clinical_study.keyword: Periodontitis; adverse pregnancy outcomes; IL-1 polymorphism
